intro: Teclea macedoi, commonly known as the Macedonian teclea, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Europe. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers, which are typically arranged in racemose inflorescences. Teclea macedoi is often found in rocky or forested habitats and is adapted to thrive in cooler, humid climates. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
